result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen D. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen D. Taylor

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Proceedings conducted via Zoom.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  No appearance by deft.  Court notes the deft's non-appearance.  Case scheduled today regarding unpaid financial obligations.  Deft will have 90 DTP.  In default, 6 days work crew or 6 days KCJ.

Hearing on June 25, 2020 at 10:45 am.  Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  http://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0K4GN_BevnIXmEq0t3FBKg
Hearing on June 25, 2020 at 10:45 am.

Cash bond applied; partial refund;   ds/nr   ck#17CH078205   HOLD PENDING PROSECUTION COST INFORMATION  VOIDED (39.00)
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty VanCuick.  Sentencing arguments made.

Count 1 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3yrs.  

Count 2 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 1yr.  

See conditions.  Probation sentences are concurrent.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  Bond shall be applied towards financial obligations.
Sentencing hearing on March 31, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hrg for 3/10/17 to be rescheduled on request of defense counsel; in addition - State did not writ deft from the RCJ; State unaware deft was in RCJ
Sentencing hrg for 3/6 moved to 3/10/17 @ 11am.  NTBS
Sentencing hearing on March 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Sentencing hrg adj to 3/6/17 @ 1:30pm.  Court would like to see what happens in Racine County with the deft's case(s).  Defense counsel in Racine attempting to get the deft into drug treatment court.  Atty Van Cuick reports, at this time, the deft's probation agent is not looking to revoke the deft's probation.
Sentencing hearing on January 5, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Brenda Van Cuick.  Deft does not want a trial, deft wishes to enter a plea to the charges with no concession.  Deft pleads guilty to both counts; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 11/30/16 @ 1:30pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Defense counsel requests of the court to accept a plea of no contest post ludwig.  Brief discussion held.  Request is denied.  Court takes a short recess to allow defense counsel confer w/her client.  Defense counsel informs the court they case will be proceeding to trial.  Due to another case going to trial, this case adjourned to 9/26/16 @ 9am.
From DA regarding additional Discovery
Petition and Order for Other Prosecution Costs rcv'd from DA in the amount of $349.00  kmk
Jury selection on July 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Brenda VanCuick appeared on behalf of deft.  JS adjourned on mutual request (drugs have not been tested to date).  JS adjourned to 7/25/16 @ 9am.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Case is not resolved.  Ludwig hrg held.  JS to remain on for 5/2/16 @ 9am
02/29/16 - Motion Hearing

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defense motion to suppress heard.  KPD Officer John Schrandt testified on behalf of the State; cross-examined by Atty VanCuick.  Court denies the motion to suppress.  Atty VanCuick may file a motion for reconsideration if she so chooses.  FPT 4/13/16 at 2:10.  JS 5/2/16 at 9:00.  Bond continued.

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Jessica Krejcarek
of Deft to Adjourn Jury Trial
to Suppress Based Upon Lack of Reasonable Suspicion to Extend the Detention of the Deft

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Motion to suppress and motion to adjourn JS date filed today by defense.  Motion to adjourn JS is denied.  JS to remain on for 2/29/16.  Suppression motion will be heard on 2/29/16 @ 2:30pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Brenda Van Cuick.  Defense requests an adjournment of the FPT.  Atty Van Cuick reports she just obtained the discovery.  Discovery from Joint Services was requested on 12/30/15 & received on 1/11/16.    Court inquired on the delay of obtaining discovery; defense counsel reports she has a busy practice at this time.  Court expects this type of delay will not happen again.  FPT adj to 2/11/16 @ 2pm.  This is the last adjournment.
Scheduling Order

Defendant Stephen D. Taylor appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 09:50 am.  Jury selection scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
